abstract: New York University School of Medicine admits that for years it sent privately donated cadavers to city morgue instead of fulfilling its promise to cremate them in dignified manner; recent investigation found number of such cadavers were buried in mass graves on Hart Island, New York City's potter's field; acknowledgement reinforces longstanding concerns about lack of regulation of body donation operations, and could have repercussions at other medical schools in New York State, which use more than 800 donated bodies a year.

headline.print_headline: Bodies Given to N.Y.U. Sent to Mass Graves
headline.main: Bodies Given to N.Y.U. Ended Up in Mass Graves, Despite Donors’ Wishes

keywords.value: New York University School of Medicine
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Cadavers at N.Y.U.’s medical school that were supposed to be cremated were buried in a potter’s field, in a practice the university admitted had gone on for years.
